results.title: NorthStar raises $15 million for debris-tracking satellites waiting on Rocket Lab
results.summary: WASHINGTON — NorthStar Earth and Space has raised another $15 million to support its first four satellites for tracking objects in orbit, the Canadian company said Dec. 6 as it waits on Rocket Lab to get back to flight so they can launch on a future mission.

results.title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX continues toward 100 launch goal
results.summary: As SpaceX continues toward its goal of launching 100 times in 2023, the company is planning to launch three Starlink missions this week — two from Space Launch Complex (SLC) 40 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) in Florida and the third from SLC-4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) in California. Launching from Launch Complex 39A on Sunday, Falcon Heavy will place the USSF-52 mission into a currently unknown orbit.

results.title: Daily Telescope: A super-hot jet 1,000 light-years from Earth
results.summary: Molecules in the outflows from the young stars are excited by the turbulent conditions.

results.title: Capella to use SpaceX for two Acadia satellite launches
results.summary: Capella Space will launch two radar imaging satellites on SpaceX rideshare missions after an Electron launch failure disrupted its deployment plans.

results.title: China launches internet technology test satellite from sea barge
results.summary: China launched a new internet technology experiment satellite from a sea platform Tuesday, apparently continuing tests for a low Earth orbit megaconstellation.

results.title: OSIRIS-REx parachute deployment affected by wiring error
results.summary: The drogue parachute on the OSIRIS-REx sample return capsule failed to deploy properly because of a design error, a flaw that did not prevent a safe landing of the capsule.

results.title: SSC Returns Esrange Launch Tower to Service After Fire
results.summary:
The Swedish Space Corporation has successfully launched the first rocket from its newly refurbished Skylark launch tower that was damaged by a fire in 2021. MAIUS-2 was launched at 07:30 UTC on 2 December aboard a two-stage Brazilian VSB-30 sounding rocket. The rocket reached a maximum altitude of 234 kilometres. The payload was successfully recovered […]
The post SSC Returns Esrange Launch Tower to Service After Fire appeared first on European Spaceflight.

results.title: Stratolaunch Welcomes The Spirit Of Mojave To Their Fleet
results.summary: Goodbye Virgin Orbit's, Cosmic Girl; Hello Stratolaunch's, The Spirit of Mojave

results.title: ISRO Returns Chandrayaan-3 Prop Module To Earth Orbit As Lunar Return Tech Demo
results.summary: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has made a surprise announcement, announcing they have successfully brought the Chandrayann-3 Propulsion Module back to Earth orbit.

results.title: Stratolaunch Conducts Captive Carry Flight of Talon-A Hypersonic Vehicle
results.summary: Stratolaunch, LLC has successfully completed a captive carry flight featuring the first powered Talon-A hypersonic vehicle, TA-1.

results.title: NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope Operations Suspended Due To Gyro Issue
results.summary: NASA iconic space observatory, the Hubble Space Telescope has suspended science operations and is in safe mode due to a problem with one of its three operational gyroscopes.

results.title: NRO signs agreements with five  commercial suppliers of electro-optical imagery
results.summary: WASHINGTON — The National Reconnaissance Office announced Dec. 5 it has signed agreements with five commercial providers of electro-optical satellite imagery, including four startups that are just starting to build […]

results.title: The 2023 SpaceNews Icon Awards: Winners
results.summary: SpaceNews established the awards in 2017 to recognize and celebrate the people, programs and institutions shaping a rapidly evolving global space economy. Chosen by SpaceNews journalists with invaluable input from […]

results.title: SpaceX plans key NASA demonstration for next Starship launch
results.summary: SpaceX could attempt a key demonstration for NASA during the third test flight of its towering Starship rocket, according to the federal agency.

results.title: Aalyria wins ESA contract and establishes European arm
results.summary: Aalyria won a European Space Agency contract to develop an orchestration system for space-based, airborne, maritime and ground-based nodes.

results.title: India reveals that it has returned lunar spacecraft to Earth orbit
results.summary: India now credibly has the third most advanced deep-space program in the world.

results.title: Daily Telescope: An ancient galaxy behind a veil of dust
results.summary: "This thing is a real monster."

results.title: Orbit Fab and Australia’s Space Machines Company cooperate on in-orbit servicing
results.summary: Australian in-space servicing startup Space Machines Company announced plans Dec. 5 to work with U.S. on-orbit refueling startup Orbit Fab to validate key technologies.

results.title: Data rights limitations affecting NASA technology development
results.summary: Development of a key capability NASA needs for exploration of the moon and Mars is being hindered by limited access to data from companies working on those capabilities.

results.title: India returns Chandrayaan-3 propulsion module to Earth orbit
results.summary: The spacecraft that transported the Chandrayaan-3 lander to the moon has returned to Earth orbit, a demonstration of technologies to support a future Indian lunar sample return mission.

results.title: SatixFy handed stock exchange delisting warning
results.summary: SatixFy is the latest space firm to face being kicked off a stock exchange after shares plummeted following a merger with a Special Purpose Acquisition Company (SPAC), a fast-track alternative to traditional initial public offerings of stock.

results.title: Industry report: Demand for satellites is rising but not skyrocketing
results.summary: A new report predicts that around 20,000 new satellites will launch by the end of the decade — a more conservative forecast compared to other sky-high projections.

results.title: York reveals latest commercial space-as-a-service mission
results.summary: York Space Systems established contact within three hours of the Dec. 1 launch of a commercial space-as-a-service mission for CACI International.

results.title: What happens in Vega didn’t stay in Vega, as key rocket parts went missing
results.summary: There's a valuable payload riding on the final Vega rocket launch.
